AC Milan will soon submit a final bid to try and buy central defender Wesley Fofana from Saint-Etienne, according to a report.

During the interview he gave to the media prior to the win over Crotone on Sunday, sporting director Ricky Massara said the management will be ready if there are the right opportunities.


MilanNews are reporting that the ‘opportunity’ could be Wesley Fofana, as the 19-year-old has been the subject dozens of positive reports from the Milan scouts, co-ordinated by Geoffrey Moncada, and they believe he could be a starter for at least 10 years.

According to Simone Cristao of Radio Rossonera, Milan will submit a final offer to sign Fofana from Saint-Etienne, and they will make a bid on the basis of a paid loan with obligation to buy.

If this offer were to be rejected then there are alternatives in mind including Matija Nastasic of Schalke.

Jens Petter Hauge is edging closer to a move to Milan. The talented winger arrived at the airport earlier today for his flight to Italy. He was interviewed by a few reporters on the scene, excited about the adventure.

After Milan reached an agreement with Bodo/Glimt last night, only the personal terms are left to finalize for the 20-year-old, per TV2Sporten.



Interviewed by Aftenposten, Hauge made it clear that it will be special to become a teammate of Zlatan Ibrahimovic. He also provided an update on the situation.

“I’m going down and meeting my agents now. They have a lot to update me on. I do not know how long contract we are talking about, but I expect to know more during the day,” he began.

“Of course you look forward to playing with Zlatan. He has been in the “game” for a long time and I will try and learn. I have followed him and looked up to him. If I get a career that is half as big as his, I will be happy,” he concluded.

AC Milan have made a loan offer for Manchester United outcast Diogo Dalot, claims Gianluca Di Marzio.



Dalot has dropped completely out of favour under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and is free to leave if a suitable offer is received.



Milan are on the market for a new right-back and enquired about loaning Dalot with an option to buy at the end of the season.



United would prefer to offload Dalot permanently this summer and any loan move would likely have to include an obligation to buy.



The Red Devils are currently in talks to sign Porto left-back Alex Telles to allow Brandon Williams to move over to right-back as cover for Aaron Wan-Bissaka.



AC Milan bid for Manchester United defender





Even Timothy Fosu-Mensah is above Dalot in the pecking order for places at Old Trafford and Telles' arrival will only compile his misery further.



United shelled out in the region of £19m to sign Dalot from Porto in the summer of 2018 and then-manager Jose Mourinho was confident he would develop into the club's first-choice right-back for years to come.



However, Dalot has made just 13 Premier League starts for United since then and was limited to just one last season, with the 21-year-old yet to feature in any competition this term.

Despite an obvious need that must be addressed, there is still the sense that everything is very up in the air regarding the rest of AC Milan’s window.

According to MilanNews, technical director Paolo Maldini has some money to spend on a central defender. It isn’t a huge amount, but it is enough to give Stefano Pioli a valuable reinforcement, while some more luxurious names such as Wesley Fofana and Nikola Milenkovic have been crossed off the list by necessity.


There are at least four names on the wish list at present, and the player at the top of it is Takehiro Tomiyasu. Bologna want €25m in guaranteed cash for the Japan international, who can also act as a right-back if necessary. At these figures the operation will struggle to take off, however.

The other three names are German Pezzella of Fiorentina, Nacho Fernandez of Real Madrid and Matija Nastasic of Schalke. For the former it will be necessary to deal with Fiorentina, Los Blancos seem willing to let the Spaniard go on loan.

For Nastasic, on the other hand, it is possible to set up a sale on a loan with option to buy. However, the report adds to beware of a surprise name, a Mister X who has not yet jumped into the media spotlight.
